3
Robert Hartman, and was based on historical research by Dumas Malone,
the Jefferson historian- The actors*—William Prince, as Jefferson;
Henry Jones, as Dickinson; Robin Humphrey, as Mrs. Graff; Jack Lester,
as Graff; and Don Julian, as a Negro servant of Jefferson?s—were all
commendable, especially Mr*. Prince, who spoke his lines as though he
fervently believed every word of them. All in all, a noteworthy
achievement.
End
